title: League Client Won't Open
body:
Whenever I attempt to open League, I get the normal League of Legends box come up, only to have this:

https://gyazo.com/8357da3f3e0ff4e17d2b34e2b0e34407

I'm not sure if this is my computer and it's graphics card is outdated, etc.
I literally got this Windows 10 laptop last year, and I don't know very much about computers, all I know is that my laptop runs on a steady 60 FPS on League.

replies.body:
Patcher Kernel errors are often caused by Windows not granting League the right permissions to operate properly. When League doesn't have permissions to interact with files outside of the League folder and certain software packages it relies on, it can cause the client to run improperly or even crash. Check out our [permissions guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) for the most common solutions for this issue. 

Let me know if you still see issues after working through that guide.
Problem solved by running as administrator, thanks!

Same prob, got to this thread of the boards: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/ZhiUJw7H-patcher-kernal-stopped-working
More ppl with our same prob
Solved the problem, check post above. ^
